rComments: Won't recommend taking his class!! Avoid his class as much as possible. He's very unclear, who doesn't do notes and no one can understand his handwriting.

Be prepared to get -.5 points for unknown reasons. He's a very picky grader, but I also think he's getting unecessary contempt. While he's a picky grader, he tells you exactly what he expects from you. He's committed to help students understand the problem.  He gives pop quizzes in class and in sections. He practically tells you the answer though.
Not a clear, generous, or able-minded teacher. Would not recommend his class.

Bruno is great. He's clearly committed to help students understand every detail of the mathematics (I really liked his extremely helpful office hours).  But this doesn't mean he let's you slack: there are weekly homework, quizzes in lectures and sections and no exceptions to deadlines (check the syllabus).

I took this class because I thought it would be an easy class and it ended up being the first class I have ever sadly failed in my entire life! Bruno is a very unclear teacher and he was very difficult to understand and his handwriting was horrendous. He is quite rude and dismissive of students and I wouldn't recommend taking any of his  classes.
Fairly obnoxious and well make his tests like IQ tests. Be ready to lose points on shocking things and hear the TAs ridicule him behind his back

His lectures are dry, but it helps. He goes over plenty of examples to help you on your homework. The lecture and sections are mandatory. During the lecture, he'll usually let you know when you have a quiz due either at the end of that lecture or at the end of the next lecture.  Go to TA's sections/office hours. He's not a bad person.

Don't take this class unless you really need it or are interested. Bruno does not really explain well in the lectures, which sucks because they are mandatory because he gives quizzes. Homework is long as well. You will definitely need  a good TA or MSI help because he isn't enough. I learn more watching youtube tutorial then going to lecture

I think he is a great professor. He makes the attendance somewhat mandatory because of pop quizzes, but come on, listening to lectures is beneficial. This professor knows the materials well and he is willing to help students out. He even gives extra credits and drops students' lowest homework/quiz grade.

Bruno Mendes is a hard professor to learn from in lecture. If you choose to take his class, try and grab Matt as your TA if he is offered ad get a section before the first class of the week. It helped immensely and I didn't have to  get extra help from bruno. I wouldn't recommend taking this course unless you are interested in the material.
He's is demanding, especially on how well you explain your answers. But there's a huge number of office hours and everyone is really trying to help you.
Bruno's lectures are the worst lectures I have ever had to sit through. I would recommend avoiding this class at all costs.
He's arrogant and demanding, but is very willing to help just really doesnt know how

Bruno Mendes is not the best AMS 5 professor. He can be confusing and grading for homework and exams is ridiculous! I mean, you get the problem right and he gives you 2.8/3! Like where did the other 0.2 go? He doesn't write down why. On the bright side his "pop" quizzes aren't really a surprise. He literally gives you the answer.

Bruno expects really exact answers for both homework and tests. It is pretty impossible to get an A. You have homework every week and it takes hours, he is nit picky about everything. The graders are all very strict and you wont get full credit on anything, no matter how much detail you share. Overall, don't take it for GE credit.

For the class itself, really understand the homework problems.  Ask for help from your peers and TAs.  You should be fine for the exams if you understand the homework and practice exam material.  As for Bruno, he's available for help via office hours/email.  Although, I find some of his remarks towards students disrespectful and rude.

Attend section to get 100% on the homework, pay attention during lecture to get 100% on the quizzes, and go over all of it to get a 90% on the midterm. You will need to pad your grade before the final. It is brutal. This was taken over the summer with a 61% average on the final exam. Note that a 60% is needed on the final to pass his class.

I totally didn't pay attention to his advice in the beginning and I just thought he was annoying; but after the midterm I realized he was right on the mark. I worked hard with him and the TA and did well in the end.
I took more than one course with him. My advice: really understand the homework problems. They will help you with those in office hours. If you got those down, you're looking at an A.

He expects you explain your work and I struggled with that until I started going to office hours. Both he and the TAs will help you learn how to structure your answers and I did pretty well in the end.

Great course. Bruno let's us understand what the mathematic formulas mean and he is super helpful. A colleague of mine complained about him, but when I asked him f he tried office hour he hadn't. I think a lot of students don't really care about the course and Bruno takes the blame for it.
I appreciated the effort he makes to engage our thinking and  helps us understand why the formulas work and what is the thinking behind the methods. If you are serious about working, you'll do great.

He was pretty clear and tells you exactly what he wants you to do. I really liked that he talked more about the concepts and this helped me understand the material a lot better. Office hours are also very helpful and a MUST! Tests were fair, so if you're shaky on your concepts you might not get the grade you want. Need to work hard for a good grade
I took two course with him, and one thing is for sure, you will work hard. For me, it was good because he was always very encouraging and I learned a lot of math.
I liked the teacher very much.I wish I had dropped by more office hours, they are very useful.
Very helpful and I liked he tried to help us understand the ideas rather than make us memorize things.

He's an awful teacher. Thank god the book was clear because he doesn't actually teach much. Half of the class he tries to inspire you that "everyone is good in maths", then he will proceed to talk about one or two problems for the other hour and fifteen minutes. The tests are always harder than the homework so there's no way to know what to study.

If you have the choice between AMS 2 and Math 3, I would definitely take this class, especially if you do not believe you are good at math. He cares more about his students, the class is smaller, and the material (for at least the first 5 weeks) is largely the same. That being said, you are going to have to work for your grade.
Bruno is very excited about the material, but his grading is unfair. Hard to understand, bad teacher. BOTTOM LINE. Glad there are TAs. Tests are vey hard.

I disliked him as a teacher, but found that his tests were much easier and more straight forward than he made them seem like they'd be. He is an ok teacher, a pretty rude person, and wasn't my favorite. But in the end I thought he was very fair.

I like very much Bruno's classes. Probably the best math course I took. My only advice is to pay attention to his advices in class, whatever he tells you to study for the test (he'll say to know very well the homework problems and use office hours), go with it!
DO NOT TAKE HIM!! Worst teacher ever! I got a B but only by my own effort and what I learned from my awesome AP Stats class from high school. Hated this whole experience.

I have a few issues with Bruno as a professor.  Not only is he late (to every single lecture and our final) which is extremely rude, he is a horrible lecturer.  It is evident that he has passion for statistics, but he doesn't know anything about how to explain concepts.  He also uses a lot of "catch phrases" (GOT IT GUYS?)

This class isn't as bad as people make it seem, although class can be boring and demanding. Class/Section are mandatory due to pop quizzes. Lectures are usually boring as he talks for nearly 2 hrs. 1 midterm (30%), 1 final (50%),Homework (10%), Quizzes (10%). But his grading is okay. 60% gets you a C in the class. 79% gets you a B+, etc.

The lectures are just Bruno talking endlessly for an hour and 45 minutes so it is very easy to space out but they are mandatory due to the in class quizzes, but that might not be incentive enough for a lot of people. The sections are also mandatory with quizzes and they are just as long as the lectures. Wouldn't recommend him!

I thought Bruno was a little sassy at first, but over time I came to appreciate his passion for statistics and high expectations for students. I didn't study much, but made sure to do all the homework and know how to do the problems. I got an A on the midterm. Bruno is an okay lecturer. however he believes in his students and tells them that.

Bruno takes this GE waaaayy too seriously. He expects too much from his students, the homework is ridiculous and out of like 10 problems only 2 of them are graded so if you happened to not do those problems you're screwed. The final is 60% of your grade for some ungodly reason. Even if you take pass/no pass if you're lower than 60 you fail.

Bruno Mendes can't teach. If you are signed up for AMS 5 drop it immediately. After the first class you will hate yourself and after the second you'll hate him. End of story. Wait until you can take the class with someone else.
Very helpful, always available and eager to help you! Just make time and put a little extra effort to get the grade you want. His lectures can be a bit boring, but he covers a lot of information.
I went to office hours and all i got was a lecture on how i should spend more time doing homework. This guy is also very cold, probably my least favorite professor at UCSC.
His handwriting is the worst! /:

His class wasn't that difficult for me, but Mendes could NOT TEACH. On a typical day of class we only got 2 problems done in 80 minutes. And attendance is mandatory with pop quizzes. I wish I didn't have to take AMS 5 for my major, but I learned everything from the helpful MSI tutor. MSI, not Mendes, got me through this class with a good grade.

Yes. Quizzes make it impossible to skip lecture or sections. But they are mostly on previous homework problems or he even solve them on the blackboard. The idea is to encourage you to work hard on the homework in order to prepare for the exams. It worked for me!
A lot of work, but he helped me a lot during office hours. He's very enthusiastic and believed in me. I recommend learning math with him
I recommend using as many office hours as possible. You learn a lot and you get a lot of help in homework. Everything went pretty smoothly.
Yes, if you go to lectures and stay involved you'll breeze through it. Bruno will go out of his way to help you. But you need to take the course seriously.

Thought this class would be a piece of cake, turned out it was a lot of hard work. Be prepared to read the book daily, do tons of homework questions and be prepared for a quiz after every other week. If you can keep up with this, then you're good. A lot of hard work is required.

This is definitely not a class for lazy people. Bruno will warn you to work hard, and he's right. You NEED to read the book, do the homework, attend lecture, and attend section. If you do all that, you will definitely succeed in this class. Bruno is super helpful, adorable, and enthusiastic. If you have ANY questions, don't hesitate to ask him.

I like that Bruno expects the best from us and was so willing to help us improve. Stats is not the easiest subject, but Bruno helps make sense of it. What worked for me was to work on as many problems as possible and get as much feedback as possible (mostly in office hours); it does take time, but it makes the course doable.

Bruno asks us to explain our reasoning (which is excellent, maths finally makes sense to me). But this required a lot of help from him or the TAs to fine tune my writing. Bruno was always available and willing to help!

Just got my final exam score and  got a pretty good one. It was easy (just like he said it would) mostly because of his awesome help. My advise is to stay in close contact with Bruno in his office hours. He tells you everything you want to know about the homework problems.

I found Bruno to be a great teacher and a nice person. However, I really did not enjoy this class overall because his tests did not measure our comprehension and often seemed like tricks. I don't recommend taking statistics with Bruno, save your GPA and having to retake the course.

He is a nice guy, but at the end of the day his teaching technique is not efficient in any way, it will screw you over. You basically have to self teach or ask ta. also he has super high expectations from his students, as if we have no other classes.

I don't even know where to start. I should have listened to everyone when they said this is a horrible class and the teacher was even worse. Never take this class, and never take it with Bruno- you are going yourself a favor. Avoid at all costs!

I hate maths and I had to take the class (no choice); Bruno really wants us to learn the basics and it did my life a little easier that he was so available (he doesn't finish his office hour until everyone had a chance to talk to him). My main recommendation is to take advantage of this.

Bruno was a wonderful teacher; he listened to all my questions and was always available to explain the ideas in Statistics. Now, towards the end of the quarter, I can actually say I understand Stats. It was a good course.

Bruno was right about working on the list of homework problems and making sure we attend lecture. He's a very nice person who helped me a lot in office hours. I think the course would've been much harder otherwise.

This class has 'mandatory' lectures because he will give random quizzes in a blue book, but you don't need to but you only need 2 blue books not the 5 he says to get. Get the book and go to msi, it helps! He is really open to office hours and wants his students to learn. In the end this class made me want to flip tables and go for a run EVERY DAY!

this class is very difficult. it made me want to flip tables, he gave a lot of examples which was kind of helpful though. Open to office hours which is also very helpful. but Im so stressed I want to go on runs every day.
Work as much as possible on the homework and everything will be good. It does make a difference.

The course starts (misleadingly) easy and it ends pretty tough. I would not be able to make it without Bruno's unwavering help.  Expect to work 10+ hours a week, especially on the second part of the quarter.

Don't be mislead my the title of the course; it IS a math class, some parts of the material are a bit challenging for someone with moderate math background like me. Fortunately, if you work on the homework with Bruno's patient help, and you work a lot you will be good.

I would not recommend this course for students with weak background in math. There are some big equations, but Prof. Bruno is very patient and I really appreciated him going slowly over the tougher parts (he literally waited until everyone said they were good, before continuing). With office hours, the homework problems aren't that hard.

Bruno is a kind professor his class isn't easy. I recommend doing all the homework's completely. I personally never went to office hours, but I think they would be helpful. The math done in this class can take long to solve, but it's better to take your time and do it correctly. Attending is mandatory due to pop quizzes based on homework problems.

Math doesn't come easy to me. But I followed Bruno's advice: didn't miss the lectures and used office hours whenever the lecture wasn't enough. I really recommend the office hours, a few minutes conversation with Bruno help me make sense of Stats.

Although I somewhat agree with those who says he's a nice guy, I can say with confidence that he's horror teacher. Class is slow and boring. Often he talks in a way that is easy to interpret in a condescending tone. I hope any of you future students of his have good TAs. You'll need them.

Horribly dry, but the tests are relatively easy. Homework was tedious. Bruno himself does put a decent effort into clarifying the material if you ask questions though. I took this class pass/fail and got through with very minimal effort.

Bruno is nice. dont see why ppl have problem with him wanting class to be quiet. only perks is he don't allow sci-calculator on any tests, but test have simple numbers. subject is easy. Had BEST TA named David- simplify everything visually and verbally. Don't follow book too much, they make it more confusing on later half topics.

Bruno is a terrible teacher. I tried to give him sometime to get better, but honestly your TA's are better at doing math than Bruno. Last winter quarter 2013, Bruno made multiple errors every lecture. We had more students correcting Bruno's arithmetic than actually learning about Gaming or Gambling. Unfortunately lectures are mandatory with quizes

do not take this class for GE he makes it unnecessarily hard and will not help you if you ask. He gives examples that are wrong during class because he doesnt prepare and takes no time in teaching it.
He's a good person. I was going through some personal challenges and he was very understanding, more worried about me than anything else. Just wanted to put it out there.
I also recommend his office hours. I learned a lot in them and made my homework scores much stronger.
Excellent teacher; you can count on his help. Go to office hours, he solves any homework problem you ask about.

Bruno gets a pretty bad rep, and I can see why. He doesn't start class until everyone is quiet, and has you explain every step of your work. But he's also one of the most supportive professors. He really wants to make sure everything is clear and the reasoning makes sense. If your willing to do the work / go to msi, you'll be totally fine.

I agree that the course is not a walk in the park; but I disagree with the reviewers who say bad thngs about Bruno. He's been outstanding helping me understand the concepts and complete the homework problems in office hours. It was the most fun math course I've taken in my life.

The material is hard; but Bruno is always ready to help. My advice is to work on the homework problems (the quizzes are usually taken from old homework problems) and use all the office hours they provide for you. I thought I wasn't good in math, but in this class I found out it just takes a bit of work and a teacher who likes to help.

Bruno is arrogant and thinks his class is superior to everything else. Most people take this pass no pass but Bruno will make your life miserable. Don't ever expect to get our early. And there are daily random quizzes for attendance. They aren't hard, they are just ridiculous.

Well, if you like math, then you will probably like his class too. But unfortunately, I hate math, so I don't really have a passion on the field. Anyways, Bruno is definitely a nice guy, but he is just not so good at teaching and explaining math. Don't go to his class unless you want tons of work and willing to work super hard. Good luck!
What worked for me was working on the homework problems and checking my answers in office hours; the final was a breeze.
He does challenge you; but he gives an unusual amount of help (mostly in office hours). The single most helpful advise is: make use of office hours. It makes an important difference.
His quizzes are easy, but you will  have to work hard in homework.
Worked for me. He's a bit strict with deadlines and with slackers; but I didn't have an issue with him. If you work hard and stay in touch you will do well.
I was surprised how nice he is given all the things are said about him on this site. I got to see him almost weekly and he was respectful, and was great at clarifying a lot of my questions.

The course is extremely tough itself, but at least Bruno made a tremendous effort to help: arranged for extra office hours with himself and organized extra tutoring and extra office hours with the TAs too.
The tests are tough and you will need his help and the help of the TAs for a decent grade

Lets be real Bruno is bad. He does not post up class notes which he always writes on the black board and its a mess. On exams he grades harshly. He loves pop quizzes he is not willing to help you out either, and he is NOT organized  (loses quizeshw). Also the way he talks he treats you like a kid. Good Luck NOT Recommended for any Class.

I see a lot of people on the website just roasting poor Bruno, but the fact is that he is incredibly invested in the success of his students, and is always eager to help you. Occasionally there are lapses in clarity, but he encourages you to ask him questions to make his lectures easier to understand.

HORRIBLE, PAINFUL. Bruno over explain everything in his lecture and treat his class like idiots. STOP TELLING US WHAT WE CAN'T LEARN AND TEACH US WHAT WE CAN LEARN FROM AMS5!!!  And he has pop quiz which "force" you to sit in every of his class.

Mendes is fair. His midterm and assignments are easy. He does grade really harshly, but come on. A 60% in the class is a C. Failing this class is an achievement on its own. His lectures are really boring and he'll give random quizzes in lecture and there are quizzes each section. In the end, the class is not hard. It's just a lot of busy work.

Thought he was the most difficult and boring teacher because I hate math. But wow, it's a miracle I scraped a B- in the class. I seriously believed I was failing that class. I was whooping for joy after because a) I'm through with math forever and b) I miraculously passed!

"You got it you guys?"  You will hear that phrase 100+ times a lecture. And you will not get it. Don't make it a drinking game you'll die.  Class isn't that hard but he will over explain everything. Do the extra homework problems and don't get behind!

I find Bruno incredibly irritating. As well intentioned as he is, he is extremely condescending; treating the class like idiots. It IS possible to teach an intro class in a way that respects the intelligence of the students. Frequently cuts-off students' questions.

Bruno Mendes, the bane of my existence. The worst prof. I have ever had. The "grader",  not a TA, not a person who attends lecture, gives arbitrary grades such as 4.35 on problems with NO feedback or comments! Since homework is such a big part of your overall grade, it messes u up. His lectures are long and boring, I only LEARNED FROM THE BOOK

Bad reviews come from those people who are lazy and did not put enough effort into the course. Bruno is very knowledgeable and inspirational. He truly is passionate about Statistics and tries his best to make the material understandable.  If you attend MSI andor office hours, it is literally HARD to fail this class. I would take his class again.

Most of the bad reviews are from people who didn't put enough effort into the course. To get a good grade you have to put a lot of work into the homework which is not a big portion of your grade, but it does help you for the tests. The quizzes were a breeze. Tests were not difficult. He's very knowledgeable & passionate about stats. Good proffesor

He is a terrible professor. He told us to do slowly to avoid making mistakes but he made mistakes in nearly every examples showed in his class. He always talk about super easy problems, which could be understand by reading the textbook by ourselves. And he never help us understand hard problems in class, only in office hours if you ask.

His class wasn't bad at all. My only problem was that we had quizzes (easy) every lecture which made class mandatory. Material is easier than I thought it would be. Work on review questions he posts online and you should pass the class easily.

I would not recommend taking Bruno for any class. His lecture are very unclear and confusing, he would pretty much talk about one topic for first hour of the class and rush through the remaining topics of the chapter in like 20min. gives random quizzes throughout the lecture for attendance. Incase you are wondering ,  It is not an easy GE class

Don't be misled by most of the  negative reviews; they are clearly written by slakers (like the guy behind me, in class, who talked - nonstop; or the one who spent the whole lecture playing with his laptop). I met Bruno sometimes twice a week on his office hours, so I know what I'm talking about and I couldn't wish for a greater teacher.

Follow Bruno's advice and study the review problems as much in advance as possible; in office hours he tells you exactly how they work. This will get you the B super easy. Just pay attention to his advice; I did and I got a really good grade.

The homework is far too much, but fortunately it is not worth much (10% and homework won't cause you to fail). No review for tests, they cover all material. Go to section and listen to the TA and you will be better off!

Homework = Excessive.  Textbook = hard to comprehend.  Lectures = Abysmal.  Horrible Professor.  He tries to keep you interested in the subject material, but fails miserably.  Do NOT take Bruno unless you ABSOLUTELY have to!
Real talk... DO NOT take this class. Bruno has to be the WORST teacher ever...AVOID Bruno at all costs!!!

If your taking this class for ams 5 do not take it, he is dreadful. The class is taught more as a english class than a math class. You cannot understand boring. not to mention he also struggles to teach you what you need to know for the tests and homework.

If you need to take a math class, and see Bruno as the teacher, look for a different section. He was extremely slow, spent 15-20 minutes talking about how it was okay if you didn't get it, kind of talked down to the students. He wore examples down tremendously. Read the book, his lectures are directly from it, but clearer and a less waste of time.

I had Bruno for both Statistics and Precalculus. He is a nice guy, but heaven forgive that he is a horrible teacher. His class structure is confusing and as long as you get a 65.6% on your final exam (Stats or Pre) then you pass the class. Go to your TA's and get help and MSI is amazing. Your book will be your best friend.

okay so what can i say about bruno? hmmm... well i honestly think that his intentions are good. You can tell that he tries really hard to make the best choices in the interest of his students, however, the grading system is crazy! lectures can be described as "Bore Wars" and the BOOK SUCKS!Clarity is the issue here, so steer clear if possible...

Lectures are virtually useless and the grading system is ridiculous. He repeatedly makes mistakes on simple concepts, makes things more confusing then they actually are and has messy handwriting. Doesn't review for the exams at all in class--study off of practice midterms/finals. Managed to get an A in the class--credit goes entirely to the book.

Horrible class.  Heavy accent, sloppy writing, and poor communication skills make Bruno an awful professor.  Awfully nice guy, but his grading system is foolish and he constantly makes mistakes in lectures.  The book and section is all you need to understand the class, but with his tests understanding the concepts is not enough to pass half the tim

OMG!!! where do i start... i honestly like bruno as a person, i really do... think that he does everything possible to get his students to understand statistics... however... his teaching needs immediate improvement... his hand writing is horrible and he makes a lot of mistakes... GO TO MSI and Office hours!

The worst class I have ever taken at Santa Cruz. Mendes tries to be a nice guy but as a professor he fails miserably. He makes a lot of mistakes on stupid simple things which make the lectures boring, useless, and worst confusing. The book was a better teacher than he was. Definantly avoid having him if you can.
He needs to write bigger on the chalkboard and speak clearly. I feel most lectures are too chaotic to stay for the entire time.

Do the HW AND the practice questions, his exams will be heavily based off the hw and practice questions. He's a very friendly guy so don't be afraid to go to office hours. Going to lecture is important.... but sometimes very frustrating.

As already said, Bruno is a very sweet teacher. He truly wants everyone to understand and have fun with material. His lectures are not helpful, they are hard to understand and see on the board. (Sloppy handwriting and light chalk) Goes very slow and does not use mathematical formulas/equations used in other statistics classes and books. Okay class

he is very hard to understand. you learn more in section than you do in actual lectures. he didnt clarify what chapter he was covering in lecture. and his grading system is ridiculous b/c he practically bases your final grade on your final exam score regardless of your performance throughout the class.
A good teacher, very flexible to the student's schedule.  However very stubborn when it comes to grading style.  If you don't do it his way, you probably won't pass

He is absolutely the WORST Professor that I have taken. He has a thick accent and his hand writing looks like a 3 year old's handwriting. There is no communication in the class. His practice final and the actual final were completely unrelated. I'm still puzzled how I received my grade when I was average in the midterms which was in the 50s-60s.
helpful but not clear

Bruno seems like a nice guy and all...BUT HE IS A HORRIBLE TEACHER. Lectures ARE NOT NEEDED and the Midterms aren't related to precal, but the final was? Bad Teacher.. I was able to get some of the highest grades in his class but it was not thanks to him. The Text book was a better teacher and the real reason for anyone that passed was the TA.

Lectures are lackluster. He's more into concepts than the formulas you actually need. He doesn't go over important info in the book, so you have to study it yourself. His wording in bad, too, and he makes A LOT of mistakes. His site with practice problems and your grades is always locked too, and you can't access it half the time.

Very enthusiastic with his lectures and a really nice guy in that he tries to help you with everything and wants you to learn concepts, not "recipes".  However, his lectures are completely useless.  You're better off reading the book because Bruno makes a lot of mistakes and everything you need to know you can get from the book.

This teacher will go over one or two examples in the book over a 1 1/2 hour lecture. He'll make it more confusing for you than it really is, and you'd be able to read over the examples in 10-15 minutes when he takes 1 1/2 hours. go to discussions and MSI, but dont go to lectures.

He covers fairly easy material in class, but the techniques he uses to teach it are needlessly difficult. He values understanding the concepts covered over getting the answers right. He wants all his students to do both, and he and his tests are not difficult. He also enjoys helping students.

i have nothin aganist bruno but i wouldnt recommend him as a understandble professor. i got use to the accent but the constant mistakes in class and his analogies were ridiculous. he does help one on one but the whole point of lecturing is to make the topic crystal clear. the way he explained everything was murky. take math 3 instead.
Awsome teacher. He really cares if you are understanding stuff. You work a lot, but it's not too hard to get a B in this class. Just stay on top of things.
Bruno's a great teacher. I like the case studies and applications of the mathematical concepts. It make sit easier to understand what we're doing and why.
Excellent teacher. Clear, enthusiastic, and if you follow the classes, sections and office hours you'll do well.
Good teacher
Great teacher. Organized and really concerned about the students

I feel bad for the guy in all honesty. I mean, he means well and cares for his students and whatnot, but when it comes to teaching, he is very unclear. Go to the tutoring sessions at MSI if you have trouble, because the lectures are way hard to pay attention in.
All you need to know is that the lectures are the most boring thing I have ever done.... I am actually sitting in one right now
Very cool and funny professor likes to see students succeed, just be sure to go to office hours, and you will do fine.

He seems interested in teaching, except he makes mistakes all the time when trying to explain it to the class.  Oftentimes he is being corrected by students.  As long as you have the book, you never have to go to class.  Just learn the material yourself.  You'll do fine!
Bruno is the man. His class was very easy going and would even help me on test while taking them. I think he might be a harder now since most of my class got A's.
No Comments
Wow.....worst teacher ive ever had. He made so many mistakes in class....

He is unsure that the class understands. Everyone needs to ask a lot of questions before he goes on or he will express coming to office hours for clarity, which do not help. See the tutor. His tutors are really good. The T.A. was not that great. He needs improvement.
No Comments

this is an experience that you will never forget. computer assignments make no sense. you will be assigned an extra section for your quiz each week. oh! don't forget the homework... it's way too much. overall easy class to pass but I would never put all my eggs in one basket.

This is the worst class I have ever taken. Bruno should not be teaching. He has no clue what he is doing. The class is very disorganized; and frankly, it is a waste of my time. The book is the better teacher than he will ever be.

his class was boring and didn't teach me anything at all. he knew his stuff sometimes, but if you want correct examples then stay with the book. The sections are the only thing you really need to go to because they have quizes, other than that the class time is best spent doing insane amounts of hw.
Dont expect to learn anything... unhelpful lectures, taught right out of book, the TA was a better teacher then him! GET OUT WHILE YOU STILL CAN!!!
save yourself. LOTS of homework with problems he never even comes close to explaining. no notes on very hard tests too. which are 80 of the grade. get out while you still can.

Lectures directly from text book, so sometimes seems like he doesn't know what he's talking about. Unclear lectures, jumping around on different topics. Assigns too much homework. Wants to be friends with the students, which is cool, and it's good that he pushes you, but it's a bit too much...

He's very clear, but teaches as if the students are complete imbeciles, and lingers forever on minute details that bear no significance. He expects the level of detail to be that of an expert statistician,which is far too rigorous and stringent for this type of course. Doesn't possess a good dynamic with the students, and ignores any feedback.

Bruno is a nice guy, but is horrible at teaching. He has bad handwriting and refuses to get better board markers. The course material isn't too hard, but Bruno over-complicates everything. His grading system is pretty strict too. Half the people in his lectures are asleep. If you must have him as a professor, go to sections and read the book.
He's really just not a good teacher and expects really tedious work, at least for AMS5. I'm assuming he's pretty bad for other classes too.

Bruno is a hard professor teaching an even harder class. Students who walk into precalculus expecting an easy time are deluding themselves. This class takes 15+ hrs of work outside of class each week. That being said, I left having learned a ton of math and feeling newly confident in my math ability. Also, a good class to take for the small size.

Bruno was a great teacher. He knows the subject well ans wants YOU to do well. He asked us many times to review the material before lab; not many did (prop the negative comments). If you do a little bit of work before coming to lab, remember this is college, you'll do great and you'll learn the subject well. Office hours are golden and a must!

not a good teacher. If you have a problem he says read the book instead of trying to explain things to you. if anything avoid this guy, or else you'll just be taking a class that is just you learning from the book.
baaaad teacher.

Completely unfair. Does not help at all during labs. Expects a student to just know all info prior to coming into lab. Demanded that Labs were still due on the day of strike even though the campus was completely shut down and even he couldnt get on campus. VERY UNFAIR. USELESS teacher. AVOID AT ALL COSTS
He is not a good teacher. He tries, but sometimes trying is just not enough. You're are definitely going to need the book for this class, even then the book is pretty confusing. Not recommended.

Bruno is the WORST professor I've had. The university should be embarassed to waste money on someone who DOES NOT TEACH, is condescending, and constantly contradicts himself. He does not teach math, he simply gives you a packet with instructions on how to push buttons on a computer. Do not take him unless you have no other choice
If you want to learn to teach yourself, this class is for you. Only when you pass this class are you truly independent. The book will be your best friend.

As soon as the class starts, he talks down to the students (like he expects you to fail) and refers to your future test scores as though you've already done badly. He expects you to teach yourself and if you want to pass the class, you will. Go to his office hours for help !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This is the worst professor anyone could ask for. He is condescending, difficult to understand, bad at teaching the material, overall horrible class experience. If you take this class and you have any difficulties with math, expect to fail. Avoid Bruno at all cost!!!!!!!

This was one of the worst classes ever, and its all because of him. The goal of a teacher is to help students, not confuse them, which is all he does. The day before our final he decides to introduce new material and only spends the last 10min reviewing for the exam. Who does that? Wastes a good 20min EVERY lecture telling you to go to office hrs.

A horrible teacher. Makes mistakes on simple examples, contradicts himself, & is very unclear about what he wants u to learn. No structure to lectures, & doesnt review for the final. HW scores largely depended on doing SAS problems, yet he never spent any time explaining it to us. If you have to take a class w/him, rely on your TA cuz he's useless.

One of the worst professors I've ever had.  He's unclear, incompetent, and worst of all, condescending. He will talk down to you and flash the dumbest, most hokey smile at you when he's doing it. The class was such a waste of time I didn't show up half the time. Class was a complete waste of time; I learned nothing. Three words: DON'T TAKE HIM!

Bruno's lectures were pointless. What he taught in class had nothing to do with the homeworks that were due. Didn't curve the 1st midterm, though people got 60-70%. 2nd midterm everyone got D's and F's so he curved it a little so people could pass. Final is worth 50% and he says regardless of your midterm and hw scores you need a 66% on final to pa

Bruno was pretty good, definitely wanted his students to succeed, as evident when you sit down in office hours. (Which were great because no one ever went-which explains the negative comments.) No doubt the tests are rough, multiple choice, and very little time but he put the brakes on the final which he made surprisingly easy.

He has a relatively thick accent, so it's hard to understand him sometimes.  As soon as the class starts, he talks down to the students (like he expects you to fail) and refers to your future test scores as though you've already done badly. He expects you to teach yourself. MSI helps, but AVOID THIS CLASS!!!!!!!

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. He teaches like he doesn't want his students to learn. His lectures where abstract and useless, his tests are brutal (the average grade on them was about 60-70% and he does not curve). I barely passed his class with a C last semester and it was all self taught from the book and homework(8+ hours a week of HW)
Did my homework, worked with Bruno and the TAs and things went well for me. Bruno's advice helped me improve a lot.
Excellent teacher. The course is not easy, but you can count on Bruno's help.

Bruno spend upwards of 30 minutes per class pleading with students to go to office hours/MSI rather than actually teaching material in class; this needs to be heavily toned down. Furthermore, when he did teach relevant material, it was often rushed and unclear -- when writing on blackboards, his handwriting was often completely illegible. Awful.

Bruno is actually quite helpful. Make sure you work on the homework and use office hours and the final will be pretty easy. If you don't do this, then the course might be a little harder. I think it's a fair deal.
Fantastic teacher; great ability to show how ODEs apply in real problems, doesn't take BS from the lazy students and is always, I mean always ready to help students.

The concepts are not easy, but Bruno does a great job explaining them. Naturally, you need to be prepared to be involved in the class (lectures, sections, office hours, MSI). If you're prepared to do this, you will learn a lot about Statistics applied to real world problems.

AMS5 is a huge course (300+ students). I and my friend made sure we worked on the homework every week and used the awesome office hours (btw, this is basically Bruno's advice); and that was what it took to get a decent grade. It can be a very tough class if you skip lectures and don't do the homework.

I for my part loved Bruno's availability.It was thanks to his weekly help that I was able to learn so much during our quarter(I'not so hot in Math).I think a lot of the comments below are mean and unfair to Bruno.Just listen to him,all his advice are useful;work hard and he will not let you down.Excellent professor.Puzzling rating in this website.

Bruno is a pretty demanding but cool guy.In the beginning I didn't follow his advise because the course seemed easy and I didn't even go to lectures.I got a pretty hard reality check in the midterm. Went to talk to him, he told me nothing was lost and offered to give me a lot of help.I got my act together and the final was a breeze.

Avoid Bruno! -overhypes the difficulty of the class -gives terse responses to whoever asks something he deems too remedial for review -requires paragraphs explaining your work, even for simple things like y=mx+b or piece-wise -final was more like an adv. algebra test w/ unclean numbers to take up the full 3hrs (the ODE parts took maybe 1/2 as long)

I can understand why everyone has rated Bruno so harshly, but he's actually not that bad. I'd suggest you go to every class and section because he gives A LOT of quizzes. But, they're really not that hard. And the most important thing to do is STUDY and attend MSI. The final is the most IMPORTANT part of the class, so give yourself a week for that.

WORST CLASS IVE EVER TAKEN. Seriously don't take this class if you can avoid it.  He has no set notes and the way he lectures is all over the place.  Super repetitive and annoying.  If you have to take this class prepare to be teaching yourself straight from the book because every component to this class is useless.

Class not mandatory. He makes everything seem way harder than it is and repeats everything several times. Also very annoying but I find him funny to watch. As long as you do all of the homework and try to go to all of the office hours, you'll be fine.
Complete idiot, I am not entirely sure he should be teaching this class (or any).  Got an A+ despite this severe drawback.  Do not take this class with him if you can help it.
WORST CLASS EVER!! do not take this class with him!! he's confusing, boring, and treats everyone like a child! AVOID REALLY!! if you've never taken stats before DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM!!

Horrible professor! So glad i am done with this class. The math and concepts are easy to learn if you don't listen to him in lecture. Just read from the book and section, its way better. If possible take this class with a different professor.

Bruno makes everything MUCH harder than it should be, but he offers tons of opportunities for help and to gain points. You get to redo missed problems on HW, quizzes, and midterm for points back. If you're a psych major, I've been told this is a lot easier than Psych 2.

I would avoid taking stats with this guy. The subject isnt that hard but dont worry he makes it hard! He is very particular in what he wants and wants it done exactly how he does it in class. if you must take a class with him then learn out of the book and go to class just to get the format that he wants the problems to be in. MSI was helpful

-lectures arent clearly dicated and poorly translated into his notes.  -the book is excellent -got an A using JUST the book -register at cramster.com for solutions -assignments prepare you very well for exams (both are tedious)  -doesn't command respect from students -disregards/excuses feedback.

The textbook wasn't very good. Also he spent a lot of time complaining about our class and threw a hissy fit a couple of times because of it. He has a poor attitude. On the first day of class he basically told us we were going to fail and to start with pre-stats. How encouraging of an educator. Glad this is over.
